title: new favicon?
content:
?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408045952im_/http:/typophile.com/files/wierdfavicon_6416.jpg)

 [‹ Chiseled/Faceted - How to - FAST logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408045952/http:/typophile.com/node/43354 "Go to previous forum topic") [Calgary: March meeting ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408045952/http:/typophile.com/node/43361 "Go to next forum topic")
author: russellm

comments.content:
Your question is?

A picture may be worth a thousand words, but this one requires a few more words.

Presumably, the question is: “Why doesn’t Typophile’s favicon show up in my browser?”

FWIW, it doesn’t display for me either on any of the following browsers: Firefox 3 Beta 4, Internet Explorer 7, Opera 9.50 beta, Safari 3.1 (all under Windows).

This issue has been [discussed before](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408045952/http:/typophile.com/node/41570).

“... Why doesn’t Typophile’s favicon show up in my browser?”
 It did show up quite nicely until I visited this little French typography site, where this funny little “T” decided to off the Typophile favicon and to attach it’s self to the Typophile bookmark tab and now, it won’t go away. It just struck me as kind of an odd little quirk. or maybe... international intrigue. :-) Don, agreed. Sometimes a worrd is worth a thousand pictures. I thopught that funny lookin’ “T” would speak for it’s self. -=®=-
